alert.note: Alert for Bonner (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 11:40PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Idaho, including the following county, Bonner. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1039 PM PDT, Gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Bonner County including Highway 57 - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
